intro: Terminthodia orbiculata, commonly known as the globe lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and striking, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance and fragrance.
